cleaned_text: Long-term immunogenicity of hepatitis A virus vaccine in Alaska 17 years after initial childhood series - PMID: 23204169 - PMCID: [PMC3611760](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/pmc3611760/) - DOI: [10.1093/infdis/jis710](https://doi.org/10.1093/infdis/jis710) Long-term immunogenicity of hepatitis A virus vaccine in Alaska 17 years after initial childhood series Abstract The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommends hepatitis A virus (HAV) vaccination for all children at age 1 year and for high-risk adults. The vaccine is highly effective; however, protection duration is unknown. We report HAV antibody concentrations 17 years after childhood immunization, demonstrating that protective antibody levels remain and have stabilized over the past 7 years.
